Class CSVExtractor

java.lang.Object
fr.u_paris.gla.project.utils.CSVExtractor
public final class CSVExtractor extends Object
A tool class to extract and convert CSV data provided into our model objects. This class expects to read the data with the Upgraded Network Format.

  • Method Details

    • makeObjectsFromCSV

      public static Graph makeObjectsFromCSV(String[] args)
      Main entry point of the parser. Launches the step, one by one, required to make the Graph object of our model.
      Parameters:
      args - The String array of file paths. Expects: index 1 being the file for stops data. index 2 being the file for junctions data. index 3 being the directory for schedules.
      Returns:
      The generated Graph object representing the transport network, null if parsing critically fails.

    • areArgumentsValid

      public static boolean areArgumentsValid(String[] args)
      Determines whether the arguments of the main function are valid. Checks that there are 3 arguments and that noone of them are empty.
      Parameters:
      args - The arguments
      Returns:
      True if the arguments are valid, False otherwise.

    • isMapDataLineValid

      public static boolean isMapDataLineValid(String[] line)
      Determines whether the specified text line is valid. Checks that there are exactly NetworkFormat.NB_COLUMNS ( 9 ) columns, And that noone of them are empty.
      Parameters:
      line - The text line
      Returns:
      True if the specified line is valid, False otherwise.

    • readStops

      public static void readStops(String[] line, Map<String,ArrayList<Subline>> mapOfLines, Map<String,ArrayList<Stop>> mapOfStopEntry, Map<Pair<Double,Double>,Stop> mapOfStops, Map<String,Line> lineById)
      Reads the info of the transport line from the tuple and calls the function to add the stops.
      Parameters:
      line - The text line from csv being read
      mapOfLines - The map of lines
      mapOfStopEntry - The map of stop entry
      mapOfStops - The map of stops

    • addStops

      public static void addStops(String[] line, Map<String,ArrayList<Stop>> mapOfStopEntry, Map<Pair<Double,Double>,Stop> mapOfStops)
      Adds the stops of the tuple being read.
      Parameters:
      line - The text line
      mapOfStopEntry - The map of stop entry
      mapOfStops - The map of stops

    • readJunctions

      public static void readJunctions(String[] line, Map<String,ArrayList<Subline>> mapOfLines, Map<String,ArrayList<Stop>> mapOfStopEntry, Map<String,Line> lineById)
      Reads a line from the junctions data CSV and adds the potential path to the transport line. Creates a Subline, and generates its potentiel path, from the text line being read in the JunctionsData CSV
      Parameters:
      line - The text line from csv
      mapOfLines - The map of lines
      mapOfStopEntry - The map of stop entry

    • buildPotentialLine

      public static ArrayList<Stop> buildPotentialLine(String[] stops, ArrayList<Stop> listOfStopsEntry, String ligne, String variant)
      Builds a potential line by calling a DFS-search.
      Parameters:
      stops - The textual stops
      listOfStopsEntry - The list of stops entry
      ligne - The transport line
      variant - The variant
      Returns:
      The list of stops representing the Subline.

    • readSchedules

      public static void readSchedules(String[] line, String fileName, Map<String,ArrayList<Subline>> mapOfLines, Map<String,ArrayList<Stop>> mapOfStopEntry)
      Read a schedule file in the fileName format: "lineName_lineID_departureStop.csv" Adds the corresponding departure time for the subline.
      Parameters:
      line - The text line
      fileName - The file name
      mapOfLines - The map of lines

    • addMissingSchedules

      public static void addMissingSchedules(ArrayList<Line> listOfLines)

    • linkStops

      public static void linkStops(Map<Pair<Double,Double>,Stop> mapOfStops, double maxDistance)
      Links all platforms of a station to allow passengers to change lines on foot. 'maxDistance' is an arbitrary value, in meters, defining the radius within a platform is considered part of the same station. FIXME: probably needs a better solution than an arbitrary value ( 150 meters right now )
      Parameters:
      mapOfStops - The map of stops
      maxDistance - The maximum distance in meters
